results.title: Phoenix. Eps. 07-08
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Corporation, Bill Hughes, Ian Gilmour and Kate Woods
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Phoenix”.
Episodes 7 and 8 of the television series Phoenix. Old Rules New Games’. Jock is frustrated with the lack of hard evidence in the case so he goes to see his trusty informant (Bill Hunter), to see if he has any information as to who may have any of the left-over stolen explosives. He gets himself into deep trouble when he steals a car that has a baby asleep in the back and it’s left to Jock to see if he can get him out of strife.Fond Memories’. Megan believes the two suspects involved in the bombing are of a violent nature who would not flinch at attacking and raping anyone. On a hunch she investigates a rape case which uncovers a possible suspect that matches the behavior and patterns of the bomber. Dennis is now the number 1 suspect for the Major Crimes unit.

results.title: Phoenix. Eps. 05-06
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Corporation, Bill Hughes, Michael Carson and Julian McSwiney
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Phoenix”.
Episodes 5 and 6 of the television series Phoenix Laz is still slowing earning the trust of his colleagues as he now believes Balcescu motors had something to do with drilling out the chassis number on the bomb car. Laz is sent through the door first on the ensuing raid, ending his days as an undercover cop for good. Forensic’s can find no link between the bombing and the garage. “Out of the Cold”. After realising that Martin’s Mine was robbed some months earlier, it becomes clear that the explosives used in the bombing came from the mine. On a night out to try and relieve some of the tension between Lochie, Laz, and Peter, Laz finds himself in strife when he protects his Senior Sergeant from the clutches of Francine, a transsexual with an eye for Lochie. He is sent for counselling to try and cope with his aggressive behavior, which in turn brings the team together for Laz has now won the boys trust.

results.title: Phoenix. Eps. 03-04
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Corporation, Bill Hughes, Ian Gilmour and Kate Woods
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Phoenix”.
Episodes 3 and 4 of the television series Phoenix. “A Bunch of Girls” (directed by Ian Gilmour). This episode brings a new member to the Major Crime Squad, Senior Constable Megan Edwards (Susie Edmonds), the first woman in the squad. Her task is to help with the ever increasing information coming in about the bombing, to see if there are any solid leads, or if it’s just useless crackpots hampering with valuable police time. Megan’s first day on the job does not go well when the accident prone Constable crashes Lochie’s car. “On The Edge” (directed by Kate Woods). Snr Det Lazarus Carides joins the task force. For the last two years he has been working undercover with the Bureau of Criminal Investigation (BCI) looking into a stolen car racket. Inspector Brennan believes the bombers and the car scam are connected and requires Laz’s assistance with some engraved chassis numbers. However, Laz has a hard time fitting in due to his stint as an undercover cop and decides to disappear to do some of his own investigating. A move that does not strengthen relations with his co-workers who view his actions as untrustworthy.

results.title: Phoebe
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Julian Biggs and George Kaczender
results.brief_description: A film story exploring the state of mind of a teenage girl when she learns she is pregnant. The film slips in and out of the present, past and future in a way that communicates her feelings in an almost subjective way. Her need to tell her parents, her boyfriend, her school principal, and to find some help in her predicament is the heart of the film. Cast: Bernard Blumer, Yael Brandeis, John Kastner, Dona Saunders, Sandra Scott, Kay Tremblay. (Awards: Five including Montreal; New York)

results.title: Philosophy: a guide to happiness
results.creator_credit: Channel Four, Neil Crombie and Celia Lowenstein
results.brief_description: In this fascinating British TV series, writer/presenter Alain de Botton’s enthusiasm and passion for philosophy is evident as he takes us on a journey of discovery about the lives and thoughts of six ancient philosophers. The somewhat complex ideas of the philosophers are simplified for the viewer by comparing them or placing them in situations and locations of contemporary western society. In the answers to life’s mystery de Botton asks some of the important questions - Will shopping make me happy? Why do traffic jams make me angry? Does romantic love equate with Happiness? Made up of six programs, each dealing with one particular philosopher, this is a great introduction to the topic of philosophy. Inspired by the book written by Alain de Botton “The Consolations of Philosophy”. Another interesting series by the same presenter is “Status Anxiety” [318889].

results.title: Phillip Island for variety
results.brief_description: Documentary from around 1935 about the attractions for tourists at Phillip Island, Victoria. Phillip Island, discovered by Bass in 1798, is a beautiful location which provides tourists outdoor activites such as swimming and surfing, and a chance to see the natural wildlife on the island such as koalas, fairy penguins and seals. Particularly interesting from a historical point of view.

results.title: Phillip and the white colt
results.creator_credit: Learning Corporation of America, John Danischewsky and Richard Sarafian
results.brief_description: A lonely mute boy encounters a wild colt, and attempts to tame it. They become inseparable. The aniimal’s life is threatened and in the suspenseful climax the boy’s love helps to save the colt and restores his own powers of speech. Edited from the 1969 Columbia motion picture entitled ‘Run wild, run free.’

results.title: Philippines: gateway to the Far East
results.brief_description: Discusses past history, present activities, and direction of future growth in hte Philippines. Includes views of farm and city life, showing raw materials and aspects of production and education in the Philippines.

results.title: Philippines No Choice but Change
results.brief_description: This film looks at the events, issues and opposition movement behind the fall of the Marcos dictatorship through the eyes of its participants including Cory Aquino, nuns, priests, lawyers, workers, farmers and guerilla fighters. Filmed all over the country, it shows why millions of Filipinos were swept into the fight for freedom.
